description: An intersection of two B\u00e9zier curves.

curve1.description: ID of the first curve in the intersection.

curve2.description: ID of the second curve in the intersection.

note.description: Description of the intersection / notes about how it behaves.

intersections.description: A list of x-y coordinates where the curves intersect.

items.description: An x-y coordinate pair for a single intersection point.
A coordinate as a numerical value.

curve1_params.description: Parameters in curve 1 of the intersection points (in the same order).

items.description: A curve parameter as a numerical value.

curve1_polys.description: The coefficients of the minimal polynomials that determine the values in ``curve1_params``. This can only be provided if both curves are defined by rational (or at least algebraic) control points.

items.description: The coefficients in a given polynomial, in order from lowest to highest exponent. For example, if a parameter is ``(7 - sqrt(7)) / 14`` (i.e. ``0x1.3e7b70cac040dp-2``) then the minimal polynomial is ``14 s^2 - 14 s + 3 = 0`` which is represented as ``[3, -14, 14]``.

curve2_params.description: Parameters in curve 2 of the intersection points (in the same order).

items.description: A curve parameter as a numerical value.

curve2_polys.description: The coefficients of the minimal polynomials that determine the values in ``curve2_params``. This can only be provided if both curves are defined by rational (or at least algebraic) control points.

items.description: The coefficients in a given polynomial, in order from lowest to highest exponent. For example, if a parameter is ``cuberoot(1/4)`` (i.e. ``0x1.428a2f98d728bp-1``) then the minimal polynomial is ``4 s^3 - 1 = 0`` which is represented as ``[-1, 0, 0, 4]``.
